column1: Kushva (Russian: Кушва) is a town in Sverdlovsk Oblast
column3: located in the Ural Mountains near Yekaterinburg. Population: 30

column1: Originally a mining settlement founded in 1735 at the Blagodat Mountain to explore its iron ore deposits
column2: it was granted town status in 1926 and was then renamed from Kushvinsky Zavod (Кушвинский Завод) to Kushva. Currently it is stagnant and its population is decreasing as most of the mining industry closed down.

column1: Within the framework of the administrative divisions
column3: together with the town of Verkhnyaya Tura and twelve rural localities
column4: incorporated as the Town of Kushva—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: Kushva and twelve rural localities are incorporated as Kushvinsky Urban Okrug. The town of Verkhnyaya Tura is incorporated separately as Verkhnyaya Tura Urban Okrug.

column1: A crater on Mars was named in honor of the town.
